thread.title: Arsene Wenger refuses to guarantee Alexis Sanchez will start against West Brom
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger refuses to guarantee Alexis Sanchez will start against West Brom

author: jsgoldman
title: Arsene Wenger refuses to guarantee Alexis Sanchez will start against West Brom
text:
Alexis Sanchez was dropped against Liverpool by Arsene Wenger last month (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger has refused to guarantee Alexis Sanchez he will retain his starting place against West Brom on Saturday.
Arsene Wenger speaks out on Barcelona's interest in Hector Bellerin The Chile international, whose future is the subject of intense speculation, was dropped from Arsenal’s most recent Premier League encounter against Liverpool last month.
Sanchez was subsequently restored to the starting XI for the Champions League pummeling at the hands of Bayern Munich and 5-0 win over Lincoln in the FA Cup, but Wenger refused to confirm his star forward would feature at the Hawthorns.
Wenger started with Welbeck and Giroud against Liverpool, claiming he wanted to play a more direct style (Picture: Getty) ‘I haven’t picked the team yet but he has a chance, yes. Of course,’ said Wenger.
Wenger dropped his top scorer for the defeat at Anfield amid suggestions of a dressing room bust-up but claimed his reason for axing the former Barcelona forward was born out of a desire to play a more direct style, hence the inclusion of Danny Welbeck and Olivier Giroud.
Arsenal fixtures West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Sunderland (H) – Sat 22 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
And ahead the weekend game against West Brom, Wenger was keen to highlight the physical threat offered by Pulis’ improving side.
‘They have a big experience, they are well organised, physically very strong and very efficient on set-pieces,’ said Wenger.
More: Football Mbappe & the four Monaco stars Chelsea, Man Utd and Arsenal should be fighting to sign

‘I think they’re the team who have scored more goals than anybody else on set-pieces.’
